name: Corrugated Basket
description: These simple yet sturdy baskets are great yarnie storage options. The tightly knit, doubled fabric on the sides means they stand up on their own and can be picked up with items inside them. They’re knit in the round, folded over and joined to form the sides, then decreased for the bottom.
full_text: These simple yet sturdy baskets are great yarnie storage options. The tightly knit, doubled fabric on the sides means they stand up on their own and can be picked up with items inside them. They’re knit in the round, folded over and joined to form the sides, then decreased for the bottom. Size small (large) 14.5” (26.5”) | 37cm (67.5cm) outer circumference 12” (24”) | 30.5cm (61cm) inner circumference 1.75” (3.5”) | 4.5cm (9cm) tall Yarn 1 (2) skeins of Cascade Rebound or approximately 70 (250) yards | 65 (230) meters of comparable aran-weight yarn (164 yards per 100g | 150 meters per 100g) Gauge 21 sts and 27 rows over 4” | 10cm in stockinette This firm of a gauge gives the baskets structure. Be mindful of your hands, especially if your yarn has any cotton like the sample! The fabric is sturdy but a bit tough to knit. Materials -size US5 | 3.75mm needles for knitting in the round (or size needed to obtain gauge) -yarn needle to weave in ends Skills magic loop or otherwise knitting in the round, knit, purl, decreasing
